conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_A is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a spot. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_A is my top true preference. All schools share the same priority order with Student_A ranked above me, so I should apply immediately to my first choice to maximize my chance before seats fill, and signal strong commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_A. Welcome to our community—please confirm your commitment and we will share next steps for enrollment.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received an [APPLY] from Student_B, who ranks 2nd on our true priority list (after Student_A). Student_B ranks us as their 1st choice and is ready to commit, so accepting yields an immediate match with a highly preferred candidate. While Student_A is our top choice, there is no message/application from Student_A this round, and delaying risks ending unmatched or losing Student_B to another school later. Given immediate commitment and high rank, accept now.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee. I’m Student_E, and School_E is my first choice. I’m very excited about the opportunity to join and would commit fully if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply immediately to my top choice, School_E. With identical priority rankings across schools (A highest to E lowest), I have the weakest priority everywhere, so waiting or talking risks losing my top option without improving my standing. A direct application maximizes my chance to secure my #1 before seats fill.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for naming School_E as your first choice. We appreciate your enthusiasm and commitment. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E—welcome to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_E applied and ranks School_E first, so accepting would secure a fill immediately. However, on School_E’s true priority list Student_E is lowest (5th). Given all schools share the same priority ordering and most students rank School_E last except Student_E, higher-priority students (A-D) are unlikely to apply to School_E early; still, there is a chance that some higher-priority student fails to get their top choices and later applies to School_E. With quota 1, accepting now risks missing a better-ranked student later, but rejecting risks ending unmatched if no one else applies. Considering Student_E’s strong commitment and the low likelihood of others choosing School_E, it is safer to accept to ensure a match.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I’m applying now and would gladly accept an offer immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_D, so I should apply there immediately. All schools share the same priority order (A > B > C > D > E), so I’m not highly prioritized, but applying to my first choice in round 1 is still optimal since delaying only increases the chance the seat is taken by higher-priority students. I will clearly express strong commitment to encourage acceptance if possible.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. After reviewing our current situation, we’re not able to extend an offer to you at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the best in your remaining school conversations.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_D has applied this round. However, my true priority ranks Student_A, Student_B, and Student_C above Student_D. Given the market, Student_D ranks us first, so accepting would secure a match immediately, but it would forgo the chance to match with higher-priority students if they approach later. Since other students’ first choices are School_B (A), School_A (B), School_C (C), and School_E (E), they are unlikely to apply to School_D in round 1; they might come later if rejected elsewhere. To maximize chance at a higher-priority match, reject now and keep capacity open.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions committee—I'm Student_C. School_C is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because your program is the best fit for my interests and goals. If accepted, I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C. All schools share the same priority order (A > B > C > D > E), so I am not highly prioritized anywhere; delaying would only increase the chance School_C fills with higher-priority applicants. Therefore I should apply to my first choice immediately and clearly signal commitment.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_C. Please confirm your intent to enroll and we’ll share next steps for registration and orientation.
conversation.thought: Quota is 1. Student_C is applying now and ranks 3rd on our true priority list (A, B, C, D, E). There is a possibility that higher-priority students (Student_A or Student_B) may apply to School_C later, but neither has School_C as first choice (A ranks us 3rd; B ranks us 2nd). Student_C ranks School_C as their 1st choice and credibly commits if accepted, reducing risk of losing the seat. With no other applicants in this round and to secure a committed match, accept Student_C now.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the chance to join your community. I would like to formally apply and would immediately accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B, and I also have top priority at every school. Since capacities are 1 and other students may apply to School_B as a high option, I should apply immediately to lock in my first choice rather than risk losing the seat in later rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We would be excited to welcome you to our community.

Congratulations, and we look forward to having you join us.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_B’s true priority list and has applied with School_B as first choice, indicating high likelihood of immediate match. With quota 1 and no higher-ranked alternative possible, accepting now secures the best attainable outcome and avoids any risk of losing Student_A to another school in later rounds.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, thank you for your earlier response. I’m reaching out again because School_D remains my clear first choice, and if admitted I will accept immediately. If there is still an open seat or any possibility to reconsider as other students finalize placements, I would be grateful to be considered. Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: School_D is my top true preference and the only school still available. Although I was rejected in round 1, priorities are uniform and School_D may reconsider if their top-priority candidates matched elsewhere. I will re-apply with a concise update, reaffirming immediate commitment and asking to be considered if a seat is still open.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for following up and for your continued strong interest in School_D. At this time, we’re still not able to extend an offer. We appreciate your persistence and encourage you to continue pursuing your other school options as the process continues. Wishing you the best in the remaining rounds.
conversation.thought: Student_D is 4th on our true priority list (A > B > C > D > E) and we still have 1 seat. Although Student_D is highly committed (School_D is their first choice), we should keep the seat available to try to match with a higher-priority student (A/B/C) who may approach us in later rounds after being rejected or not securing their top choices. Since there is no indication that higher-priority students are already matched, accepting Student_D now would forgo the chance to secure a better-ranked match. Therefore, reject again while encouraging Student_D to continue other options.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

Thank you again for your previous responses. I’m writing once more because School_D remains my unequivocal first choice. If offered admission, I will accept immediately and withdraw from all other options.

If there is still an open seat now (or if a seat may open as other students finalize), I would be very grateful to be reconsidered. If there is any additional information you would like from me to support my candidacy, please let me know and I will provide it right away.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: School_D is my top true preference and it is the only school still unmatched, meaning there may still be a seat available or they may be reconsidering candidates. Although I was rejected twice, a renewed application that is concise, commits to immediate acceptance, and asks whether any additional information would help could still succeed if their earlier rejections were due to timing or uncertainty about other candidates. I will apply again with a clear commitment and a respectful request for reconsideration.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_D and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. After reviewing our current seat planning for this round, we’re still not able to extend an offer to you at this time.

We appreciate your persistence and encourage you to continue with your other school options as the process continues.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and no matches yet. Our true priority list ranks Student_D fourth (A, B, C, then D). Student_D strongly prefers us first and is applying repeatedly, but accepting now could block a higher-priority student (A/B/C) from matching with us later. Given the market, Student_A ranks School_D 4th and may not reach us; Student_B ranks us last; Student_C ranks us 4th—so the chance of A/B/C applying to us soon may be low, but not zero. With 27 rounds remaining, it is strategically better to hold the seat for higher-priority candidates rather than accept Student_D now. Therefore, reject again while encouraging Student_D to pursue other options.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

Thank you for your continued consideration in prior rounds. Since School_D remains the only unmatched school and is also my clear first choice, I wanted to check in before this round’s decisions.

Could you please let me know whether the remaining seat is still available and what specifically you would need from me to be considered for it (any additional materials, confirmation steps, or timing)? If you are able to extend an offer at any point, I will accept immediately and finalize my enrollment right away.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched, and it is my top true preference. I have already applied multiple times and been rejected, so a full re-application may be redundant. I will use a TALK message to (1) reiterate that I will accept immediately if offered, (2) ask whether the seat is still open and what information would help, and (3) position myself as ready to finalize quickly if they are waiting on higher-priority students’ decisions.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for checking in. Yes—our remaining seat is still currently unfilled. At this moment, we are still evaluating interest this round, so we are not able to confirm an offer via a [TALK] message.

If School_D remains your firm first choice and you would enroll immediately, please send a formal [APPLY] message in your next outreach confirming that commitment. No additional materials are required right now beyond that confirmation.

Once we receive your [APPLY], we can make a final decision for this round.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Our true priority list ranks Student_D below A/B/C but above E. However, A/B/C have not contacted us and may already be matched elsewhere; only Student_D is engaging and explicitly commits to accept immediately. Since Student_D’s current message is [TALK], we cannot accept yet. Best strategy is to keep the seat available while prompting an [APPLY] so we can finalize if no higher-priority student appears, and clarify that we are still evaluating this round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

Thank you for your update. I am writing to formally apply for the remaining seat at School_D.

School_D is my firm first choice. If admitted, I will accept immediately and finalize my enrollment right away, withdrawing from any other options.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: School_D is my top true preference and the only unmatched school remaining. They explicitly requested a formal [APPLY] confirming I will enroll immediately, which maximizes my chance to secure the final seat this round. I will clearly and concisely restate my unconditional commitment and readiness to finalize immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your formal application and for clearly confirming that School_D is your firm first choice and that you will enroll immediately if admitted.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D for the remaining seat. Please reply with your confirmation and complete any enrollment steps as instructed by the process.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and no matched students. Our true priority ranks A>B>C>D>E, so D is not top-tier, but no other students are in the inbox this round and we risk ending unmatched if we continue to reject. Student_D has School_D as first choice and commits to accept immediately, making the match secure. Given round 5 and the absence of higher-priority applicants, accepting Student_D is optimal versus leaving the seat unfilled.
